intro: Matelea andina, commonly known as the Andean mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a velvety texture. Matelea andina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in high-altitude, sunny environments.
